commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables DOM agent for the given page.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables DOM agent for the given page.

commands.name: getDocument
commands.description: Returns the root DOM node (and optionally the subtree) to the caller.

commands.name: hideHighlight
commands.description: Hides any highlight.

commands.name: highlightNode
commands.description: Highlights DOM node.

commands.name: pushNodesByBackendIdsToFrontend
commands.description: Requests that a batch of nodes is sent to the caller given their backend node ids.

parameters.name: backendNodeIds
parameters.description: The array of backend node ids.

returns.name: nodeIds
returns.description:
The array of ids of pushed nodes that correspond to the backend ids specified in
backendNodeIds.

commands.name: performSearch

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Plain text or query selector or XPath search query.

parameters.name: includeUserAgentShadowDOM
parameters.description: True to search in user agent shadow DOM.

commands.description: Searches for a given string in the DOM tree. Use getSearchResults to access search results or cancelSearch to end this search session.

commands.name: getSearchResults

parameters.name: searchId
parameters.description: Unique search session identifier.

parameters.name: fromIndex
parameters.description: Start index of the search result to be returned.

parameters.name: toIndex
parameters.description: End index of the search result to be returned.

returns.name: nodeIds
returns.description: Ids of the search result nodes.

commands.description: Returns search results from given fromIndex to given toIndex from the search with the given identifier.

commands.name: discardSearchResults

parameters.name: searchId
parameters.description: Unique search session identifier.

commands.description: Discards search results from the session with the given id. getSearchResults should no longer be called for that search.

commands.name: dispatchMouseEvent

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: Mouse event to dispatch.

commands.description: Dispatch a mouse event for a given node. Only used for UI Devtools.

commands.name: dispatchKeyEvent

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node.

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: Keyboard event to dispatch.

commands.description: Dispatch a keyboard event for a given node. Only used for UI Devtools.

domains.description:
This domain exposes DOM read/write operations. Each DOM Node is represented with its mirror object that has an `id`. This `id` can be used to get additional information on the Node, resolve it into the JavaScript object wrapper, etc. It is important that client receives DOM events only for the nodes that are known to the client. Backend keeps track of the nodes that were sent to the client and never sends the same node twice. It is client's responsibility to collect information about the nodes that were sent to the client.

Note that `iframe` owner elements will return corresponding document elements as their child nodes.

parameters.name: parentNodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node that has changed.

parameters.name: previousNodeId
parameters.description: If of the previous siblint.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: Inserted node data.

parameters.name: parentNodeId
parameters.description: Parent id.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node that has been removed.

types.description: Unique DOM node identifier.

Unique DOM node identifier used to reference a node that may not have been pushed to the
front-end.

DOM interaction is implemented in terms of mirror objects that represent the actual DOM nodes.
DOMNode is a base node mirror type.

properties.name: nodeId
properties.description:
Node identifier that is passed into the rest of the DOM messages as the `nodeId`. Backend
will only push node with given `id` once. It is aware of all requested nodes and will only
fire DOM events for nodes known to the client.

properties.name: children
properties.description: Child nodes of this node when requested with children.

properties.name: attributes
properties.description: Attributes of the `Element` node in the form of flat array `[name1, value1, name2, value2]`.

types.description: A structure holding an RGBA color.

properties.name: r
properties.description: The red component, in the [0-255] range.

properties.name: g
properties.description: The green component, in the [0-255] range.

properties.name: b
properties.description: The blue component, in the [0-255] range.

properties.name: a
properties.description: The alpha component, in the [0-1] range (default: 1).

types.description: Used by dispatchMouseEvent. Only used for UI DevTools.

properties.name: x
properties.description: x position relative to the node.

properties.name: y
properties.description: y position relative to the node.

types.description: Used by dispatchKeyEvent. Only used for UI DevTools. Mirroring the KeyEvent class from ui/events/event.h

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Event flags for keyboard modifiers. Definition: ui/events/event_constants.h

properties.name: key
properties.description: Provide meaning of a key. It's either a dom key value for a key stroke event or an unicode character for a character event.

properties.name: isChar
properties.description: Whether it's a character event or a key stroke event.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables the CSS agent for the given page.

commands.name: enable
commands.description:
Enables the CSS agent for the given page. Clients should not assume that the CSS agent has been
enabled until the result of this command is received.

commands.name: getMatchedStylesForNode
commands.description: Returns requested styles for a DOM node identified by `nodeId`.

returns.name: matchedCSSRules
returns.description: CSS rules matching this node, from all applicable stylesheets.

commands.name: getStyleSheetText
commands.description: Returns the current source content for a stylesheet.

commands.name: setStyleTexts
commands.description: Applies specified style edits one after another in the given order.

domains.description:
This domain exposes CSS read/write operations. All CSS objects (stylesheets, rules, and styles)
have an associated `id` used in subsequent operations on the related object. Each object type has
a specific `id` structure, and those are not interchangeable between objects of different kinds.
CSS objects can be loaded using the `get*ForNode()` calls (which accept a DOM node id). A client
can also keep track of stylesheets via the `styleSheetAdded`/`styleSheetRemoved` events and
subsequently load the required stylesheet contents using the `getStyleSheet[Text]()` methods.

events.name: styleSheetChanged
events.description: Fired whenever a stylesheet is changed as a result of the client operation.

events.name: styleSheetAdded

parameters.name: header
parameters.description: Added stylesheet metainfo.

events.description: Fired whenever an active document stylesheet is added.

types.description: Text range within a resource. All numbers are zero-based.

properties.name: important
properties.description: Whether the property has "!important" annotation (implies `false` if absent).

types.description: CSS style representation.

properties.name: styleSheetId
properties.description:
The css style sheet identifier (absent for user agent stylesheet and user-specified
stylesheet rules) this rule came from.

properties.name: shorthandEntries
properties.description: Computed values for all shorthands found in the style.

properties.name: range
properties.description: Style declaration range in the enclosing stylesheet (if available).

types.description: CSS property declaration data.

properties.name: range
properties.description: The entire property range in the enclosing style declaration (if available).

types.description: Match data for a CSS rule.

properties.name: matchingSelectors
properties.description: Matching selector indices in the rule's selectorList selectors (0-based).

properties.name: range
properties.description: Value range in the underlying resource (if available).

types.description: Data for a simple selector (these are delimited by commas in a selector list).
Selector list data.

properties.name: startLine
properties.description: Line offset of the stylesheet within the resource (zero based).

properties.name: startColumn
properties.description: Column offset of the stylesheet within the resource (zero based).

types.description: CSS stylesheet metainformation.
CSS rule representation.

properties.name: styleSheetId
properties.description: The css style sheet identifier (absent for user agent stylesheet and user-specified stylesheet rules) this rule came from.

types.description: A descriptor of operation to mutate style declaration text.

properties.name: range
properties.description: The range of the style text in the enclosing stylesheet.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables domain notifications.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables domain notifications.

commands.name: hideHighlight
commands.description: Hides any highlight.

commands.name: highlightNode
commands.description:
Highlights DOM node with given id or with the given JavaScript object wrapper. Either nodeId or
objectId must be specified.

parameters.name: highlightConfig
parameters.description: A descriptor for the highlight appearance.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Identifier of the node to highlight.

commands.name: setInspectMode
commands.description:
Enters the 'inspect' mode. In this mode, elements that user is hovering over are highlighted.
Backend then generates 'inspectNodeRequested' event upon element selection.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Set an inspection mode.

parameters.name: highlightConfig
parameters.description:
A descriptor for the highlight appearance of hovered-over nodes. May be omitted if `enabled
== false`.

domains.description: This domain provides various functionality related to drawing atop the inspected page.

events.name: inspectNodeRequested
events.description:
Fired when the node should be inspected. This happens after call to `setInspectMode` or when
user manually inspects an element.

parameters.name: backendNodeId
parameters.description: Id of the node to inspect.

events.name: nodeHighlightRequested
events.description: Fired when the node should be highlighted. This happens after call to `setInspectMode`.

types.description: Configuration data for the highlighting of page elements.

properties.name: showInfo
properties.description: Whether the node info tooltip should be shown (default: false).

properties.name: showRulers
properties.description: Whether the rulers should be shown (default: false).

properties.name: showExtensionLines
properties.description: Whether the extension lines from node to the rulers should be shown (default: false).

properties.name: contentColor
properties.description: The content box highlight fill color (default: transparent).

properties.name: paddingColor
properties.description: The padding highlight fill color (default: transparent).

properties.name: borderColor
properties.description: The border highlight fill color (default: transparent).

properties.name: marginColor
properties.description: The margin highlight fill color (default: transparent).

properties.name: eventTargetColor
properties.description: The event target element highlight fill color (default: transparent).

properties.name: shapeColor
properties.description: The shape outside fill color (default: transparent).

properties.name: shapeMarginColor
properties.description: The shape margin fill color (default: transparent).

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables domain notifications.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables domain notifications.

commands.name: getResourceTree
commands.description: Called when UI DevTools first loads. Used to populate sources panel.

commands.name: getResourceContent
commands.description: Returns source file content of the given resource.

parameters.name: frameId
parameters.description: Frame id to get resource for.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the resource to get content for.

returns.name: base64Encoded
returns.description: True, if content was served as base64.

domains.description: Actions and events related to the inspected page belong to the page domain.

types.description: Resource type as it was perceived by the rendering engine.
Information about the Frame on the page.
Information about the Resource on the page.

properties.name: mimeType
properties.description: Resource mimeType as determined by the browser.

types.description: Information about the Frame hierarchy along with their cached resources.

properties.name: frame
properties.description: Frame information for this tree item.

commands.name: start
commands.description: Start trace events collection.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Category/tag filter

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Tracing options

parameters.name: bufferUsageReportingInterval
parameters.description: If set, the agent will issue bufferUsage events at this interval, specified in milliseconds

commands.name: end
commands.description: Stop trace events collection.

commands.name: disable
commands.description: Disables Tracing agent for the given page.

commands.name: enable
commands.description: Enables Tracing agent for the given page.

events.name: dataCollected
events.description: Contains a bucket of collected trace events. When tracing is stopped collected events will be sent as a sequence of dataCollected events followed by tracingComplete event.

events.name: tracingComplete
events.description: Signals that tracing is stopped and there is no trace buffers pending flush, all data were delivered via dataCollected events.

parameters.name: dataLossOccurred
parameters.description: A handle of the stream that holds resulting trace data.

parameters.name: percentFull
parameters.description: A number in range [0..1] that indicates the used size of event buffer as a fraction of its total size.

parameters.name: eventCount
parameters.description: An approximate number of events in the trace log.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: A number in range [0..1] that indicates the used size of event buffer as a fraction of its total size.
